COURAGE: I reject victimhood and boldly perservere, even in times of… https://t.co/D53oagAq3Q

note_tweet.text:
At the high school where I now teach, we have no DEI. Instead students memorize sayings attached to four cardinal virtues: COURAGE, JUSTICE, TEMPERANCE, and WISDOM. These are the sayings I write from memory. 

COURAGE: I reject victimhood and boldly perservere, even in times of uncertainty and struggle. 

JUSTICE: I uphold our common humanity, and honor the inherent dignity of each individual. 

TEMPERANCE: I lead my life with self-discipline, because I am responsible for my learning and behavior. 

WISDOM: I make sound judgements, based on knowledge and objective, universal truth. 

Many of our students, who struggle with many challenges, find these statements unfamiliar and corny at first. But over time, I have seen these sayings start to have an effect, in ways that are subtle and impactful in their lives. 

I’m proud to be teaching at such a place, so different from my former school. These sayings comprise a code that would help ANY young person such as those in “elite” schools like my former school. Kids there are lucky enough to have far more opportunities, but suffer from the promotion of divisive identitarian jargon that undermines their agency and sense of fellowship with their common man. 

Our school is not perfect but we get this right.
